h6801.definition: a primitive root; to wrap, i.e. roll or dress; be attired, × surely, violently turn.

h6803.definition: from the same as {{h6791}}; a vase (probably a vial tapering at the top); pot.

h6804.definition: probably from the same as {{h6794}}; a tube; pipe.

h6805.definition: a primitive root; to pace, i.e. step regularly; (upward) to mount; (along) to march; (down and causatively) to hurl; bring, go, march (through), run over.

h6806.definition: from {{h6804}}; a pace or regular step; pace, step.

h6807.definition: feminine of {{h6806}}; a march; (concretely) an (ornamental) ankle-chain; going, ornament of the legs.

h6808.definition: a primitive root; to tip over (for the purpose of spilling or pouring out), i.e. (figuratively) depopulate; by implication, to imprison or conquer; (reflexive) to lie down (for coitus); captive exile, travelling, (cause to) wander(-er).

h6809.definition: from an unused root meaning to wrap over; a veil; vail.

h6810.definition: or צָעוֹר; from {{h6819}}; little; (in number) few; (in age) young, (in value) ignoble; least, little (one), small (one),   young(-er, -est).

h6811.definition: the same as {{h6810}}; Tsair, a place in Idumaea; Zair.

h6812.definition: feminine of {{h6810}}; smallness (of age), i.e. juvenility; youth.

h6813.definition: a primitive root; to load up (beasts), i.e. to migrate; be taken down.

h6814.definition: of Egyptian derivation; Tsoän, a place in Egypt; Zoan.

h6815.definition: or (dual) צַעֲנַיִם; plural from {{h6813}}; removals; Tsaanannim or Tsaanajim, a place in Palestine; Zaannannim, Zaanaim.

h6816.definition: from an unused root meaning to bestrew with carvings; sculpture; image (work).

h6817.definition: a primitive root; to shriek; (by implication) to proclaim (an assembly); × at all, call together, cry (out), gather (selves) (together).

h6819.definition: a primitive root; to be small, i.e. (figuratively) ignoble; be brought low, little one, be small.

h6820.definition: from {{h6819}}; little; Tsoar, a place East of the Jordan; Zoar.

h6821.definition: a primitive root; to adhere; cleave.

h6822.definition: a primitive root; properly, to lean forward, i.e. to peer into the distance; by implication, to observe, await; behold, espy, look up (well), wait for, (keep the) watch(-man).

h6823.definition: a primitive root (probably identical with {{h6822}} through the idea of expansion in outlook, transferring to action); to sheet over (especially with metal); cover, overlay.

h6825.definition: or צְפִי; from {{h6822}}; observant; Tsepho or Tsephi, an Idumaean; Zephi, Zepho.

h6827.definition: probably for {{h6837}}; Tsephon, an Israelite; Zephon.

h6828.definition: or צָפֹן; from {{h6845}}; properly, hidden, i.e. dark; used only of the north as a quarter (gloomy and unknown); north(-ern, side, -ward, wind).

h6829.definition: the same as {{h6828}}; boreal; Tsaphon, a place in Palestine; Zaphon.

h6831.definition: patronymically from {{h6827}}; a Tsephonite, or (collectively) descendants of Tsephon; Zephonites.

h6832.definition: from the same as {{h6848}}; excrement (as protruded); dung.

h6833.definition: or צִפֹּר; from {{h6852}}; a little bird (as hopping); bird, fowl, sparrow.

h6834.definition: the same as {{h6833}}; Tsippor, a Moabite; Zippor.

h6835.definition: from an unused root meaning to expand; a saucer (as flat); cruse.

h6837.definition: from {{h6822}}; watch-tower; Tsiphjon, an Israelite; Ziphion. Compare {{h6827}}.

h6838.definition: from the same as {{h6835}}; a flat thin cake; wafer.

h6839.definition: plural of active participle of {{h6822}}; watchers; Tsophim, a place East of the Jordan; Zophim.

h6842.definition: from {{h6852}}; a male goat (as prancing); (he) goat.

h6843.definition: feminine formed like {{h6842}}; a crown (as encircling the head); also a turn of affairs (i.e. mishap); diadem, morning.

h6845.definition: a primitive root; to hide (by covering over); by implication, to hoard or reserve; figuratively to deny; specifically (favorably) to protect, (unfavorably) to lurk; esteem, hide(-den one, self), lay up, lurk (be set) privily, (keep) secret(-ly, place).

h6846.definition: or צְפַנְיָהוּ; from {{h6845}} and {{h3050}}; Jah has secreted; Tsephanjah, the name of four Israelites; Zephaniah.

h6847.definition: of Egyptian derivation; Tsophnath-Paneach, Joseph's Egyptian name; Zaphnath-paaneah.

h6848.definition: from an unused root meaning to extrude; a viper (as thrusting out the tongue, i.e. hissing); adder, cockatrice.

h6849.definition: feminine from the same as {{h6848}}; an outcast thing; issue.

h6850.definition: a primitive root; to coo or chirp (as a bird); chatter, peep, whisper.

h6851.definition: from {{h6687}}; a willow (as growing in overflowed places); willow tree.

h6852.definition: a primitive root; to skip about, i.e. return; depart early.

h6854.definition: from {{h6852}} and a word elsewhere unused meaning a swamp; a marsh-leaper, i.e. frog; frog.

h6855.definition: feminine of {{h6833}}; bird; Tsipporah, Moses’ wife; Zipporah.

h6856.definition: from {{h6852}} (in the denominative sense (from {{h6833}}) of scratching); properly, a claw, i.e. (human) nail; also the point of a style (or pen, tipped with adamant); nail, point.

h6857.definition: from {{h6822}}; watch-tower; Tsephath, a place in Palestine; Zephath.

h6858.definition: from an unused root meaning to encircle; a capital of a column; chapiter.

h6859.definition: the same as {{h6857}}; Tsephathah, a place in Palestine; Zephathah.

h6860.definition: or צִיקלַג; (1 Chronicles 12:1,20), of uncertain derivation; Tsiklag or Tsikelag, a place in Palestine; Ziklag.

h6861.definition: from an unused root meaning to wind; a sack (as tied at the mouth); husk.

h6862.definition: or צָר; from {{h6887}}; narrow; (as a noun) a tight place (usually figuratively, i.e. trouble); also a pebble (as in {{h6864}}); (transitive) an opponent (as crowding); adversary, afflicted(-tion), anguish, close, distress, enemy, flint, foe, narrow, small, sorrow, strait, tribulation, trouble.

h6863.definition: from {{h6887}}; rock; Tser, a place in Palestine; Zer.

h6864.definition: from {{h6696}}; a stone (as if pressed hard or to a point); (by implication, of use) a knife; flint, sharp stone.

h6865.definition: or צוֹר; the same as {{h6864}}; a rock; Tsor, a place in Palestine; Tyre, Tyrus.

h6866.definition: a primitive root; to burn; burn.

h6867.definition: from {{h6866}}; conflagration (of fire or disease); burning, inflammation.

h6868.definition: or צְרֵדָתָה; apparently from an unused root meaning to pierce; puncture; Tseredah, a place in Palestine; Zereda, Zeredathah.

h6869.definition: feminine of {{h6862}}; tightness (i.e. figuratively, trouble); transitively, a female rival; adversary, adversity, affliction, anguish, distress, tribulation, trouble.

h6870.definition: feminine passive participle from the same as {{h6875}}; wounded; Tserujah, an Israelitess; Zeruiah.

h6871.definition: feminine passive participle of {{h6879}}; leprous; Tseruah, an Israelitess; Zeruah.

h6872.definition: or (shorter) צְרֹר; from {{h6887}}; a parcel (as packed up); also a kernel or particle (as if a package); bag, × bendeth, bundle, least grain, small stone.

h6873.definition: a primitive root; to be clear (in tone, i.e. shrill), i.e. to whoop; cry, roar.

h6874.definition: the same as {{h6875}}; Tseri, an Israelite; Zeri. Compare {{h3340}}.

h6875.definition: or צֳרִי; from an unused root meaning to crack (as by pressure), hence, to leak; distillation, i.e. balsam; balm.

h6876.definition: patrial from {{h6865}}; a Tsorite or inhabitant of Tsor (i.e. Syrian); (man) of Tyre.

h6877.definition: from {{h6873}} in the sense of clearness of vision; a citadel; high place, hold.

h6878.definition: from an unused root meaning to need; need; need.

h6879.definition: a primitive root; to scourge, i.e. (intransitive and figurative) to be stricken with leprosy; leper, leprous.

h6881.definition: apparently another form for {{h6880}}; Tsorah, a place in Palestine; Zareah, Zorah, Zoreah.

h6882.definition: or צׇרְעָתִי; patrial from {{h6881}}; a Tsorite or Tsorathite, i.e. inhabitants of Tsorah; Zorites, Zareathites, Zorathites.

h6884.definition: a primitive root; to fuse (metal), i.e. refine (literally or figuratively); cast, (re-) fine(-er), founder, goldsmith, melt, pure, purge away, try.

h6885.definition: from {{h6884}}; refiner; Tsorephi (with the article), an Israelite; goldsmith's.

h6886.definition: from {{h6884}}; refinement; Tsarephath, a place in Palestine; Zarephath.

h6887.definition: a primitive root; to cramp, literally or figuratively, transitive or intransitive; adversary, (be in) afflict(-ion), beseige, bind (up), (be in, bring) distress, enemy, narrower, oppress, pangs, shut up, be in a strait (trouble), vex.

h6888.definition: apparently by erroneous transcription for {{h6868}}; Tsererah for Tseredah; Zererath.

h6889.definition: perhaps from {{h6671}}; splendor; Tsereth, an Israelite; Zereth.

h6890.definition: from the same as {{h6889}} and {{h7837}} with the article interposed; splendor of the dawn; Tsereth-hash-Shachar, a place in Palestine; Zareth-shahar.

h6891.definition: perhaps for {{h6868}}; Tsarethan, a place in Palestine; Zarthan.

h6893.definition: from {{h6958}}; probably the pelican (from vomiting); cormorant.

h6894.definition: from {{h6895}}; a hollow, i.e. vessel used as a (dry) measure; cab.

h6895.definition: a primitive root; to scoop out, i.e. (figuratively) to malign or execrate (i.e. stab with words); × at all, curse.

h6896.definition: from {{h6895}}; the paunch (as a cavity) or first stomach of ruminants; maw.

h6897.definition: from {{h6895}}; the abdomen (as a cavity); belly.

h6898.definition: from {{h6895}}; a pavilion (as a domed cavity); tent.

h6900.definition: or קְבֻרָה; feminine passive participle of {{h6912}}; sepulture; (concretely) a sepulchre; burial, burying place, grave, sepulchre.
